official-title.#text:
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow
		  taxpayers to designate overpayments of tax as contributions and to make
		  additional contributions to the Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund, and for
		  other purposes.

committee-name.#tail:
, and in
			 addition to the Committee on

			 of 2013

Contributions

text.#text:
Every individual,
				with respect to the taxpayer’s return for the taxable year of the tax imposed
				by

may designate that a specified portion (not
				less than $1) of any overpayment of tax shall be paid over to the Homeless
				Veterans Assistance Fund in accordance with the provisions of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:

				amount which shall be paid over to such Fund.

prescribes by regulations except that, if such designation is made at the time
				of filing the return of the tax imposed by chapter 1 for such taxable year,
				such designation shall be made either on the first page of the return or on the
				page bearing the taxpayer’s signature.

Such
				designation and contribution shall be made in such manner as the

Subchapter A of chapter 98 of the
			 Internal Revenue Code of 1986

term.#tail:

text.#text:
There is established in the Treasury of the United
				States a trust fund to be known as the

There are hereby appropriated to the Homeless Veterans
				Assistance Fund amounts equivalent to the amounts designated and contributed
				under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, amounts in the
				Homeless Veterans Assistance Fund shall be available (and shall remain

Department of Labor Veterans' Employment and Training
				Service
